availabilityNotes: The presence of Anti-C1q autoantibodies is associated with several autoimmune and renal illnesses. Containing an occurrence of 100% in the hypocomplementaemic urticarial vasculitis syndrome (HUVS), Anti-C1q autoantibodies act as a diagnostic marker for this disease.  They were also described in SLE and especially in lupus nephritis.  It was discovered that up to 60% of patients with SLE and up to 80% of patients with diffuse proliferative lupus nephritis have such antibodies. Anti-C1q autoantibodies were also reported in various other rheumatic diseases such as FELTY's syndrome, rheumatoid vasculitis or classic polyarteritis nodosa.;Availability 2-3 times a week

1.     Print off request form from Insight webpage (Search IGRA or Quantiferon) ;2.     Complete all clinical details appropriately. Specimens that are accompanied by unfilled forms may not be processed.;3.     Request the Interferon tubes (Quantiferon TB Gold) by calling 020 7307 7373.;4.     Discuss with this number where the tubes are to be brought, and when they can be collected by couriers.;5.     Couriers will bring you the tubes to where you tell them within 30 mins.;6.     Take the blood into the 3 tubes – they are vacutainer tubes so take exactly 1 ml, (pre-take some blood into another tube if you are using a butterfly so as not to suck in any air);7.     Mix the tubes by shaking them for about 10 seconds.;8.     Label the tubes and provide the specimen time.;9.     Place filled tubes back in the box provided or in a sealed plastic specimen bag.;10.  Ensure that there is the form with the tubes.;11.  If tube collection has not previously arranged, call couriers on 020 7307 7388. It is essential that the tubes reach the laboratory rapidly for incubation otherwise the test will be invalid. Do NOT send the tubes via the pod system or local porters.

IFAT (screening titre 1/80) is an essential test in cases of suspected amoebic liver;Abscess (ALA);;A Cellulose Acetate Precipitin test (CAP) will be performed if the IFAT is positive. This test is less sensitive than the IFAT. A positive is confirmatory evidence of an active or recently treated infection. A negative CAP in the presence of a positive IFAT may suggest early infection, a treated case, past infection or occasionally, a false positive IFAT. After treatment the CAP is the first to become negative, sometimes as soon as one month but occasionally after one year.
turnaroundTime: Multiplex PCR-E. histolytica, Giardia & Cryptosporidia 8 working days;Amoebic IFAT less than 2 working days

availabilityNotes: The molecular test for microsporidial species offers several advantages over standard microscopy based diagnostics. The assay is significantly more sensitive (greater than one hundred fold improvement in the limit of detection) than light microscopy. ;In addition the assay is semi quantitative and can therefore reveal detailed information on the response of a patient’s parasitic load to subsequent drug therapy. ;Finally, the assay can differentiate between morphologically identical microsporidia, a feat only possible previously with electron microscopy.
